column4: Does anyone here know if it is possible to stream movies from a windows share in ubuntu?  Is there a particular movie player I need for that?
VLC works pretty well for streaming video cross-platform
I have, it's a pretty cool live CD but I was a huge fan of Whax and Whoppix too. backtrack is better

My concern is that I'll need to update drivers, etc for my wireless devices.  How is that done when just running on a livedisc?  Maybe it has everything you need for the most common devices? Atheros, Ralink, etc?
actuall backtrack is based of Slax which has a really easy way of adding files to the livecd check out the slax website for how to add custom modules
well, I'm just going to burn the disc and get a feel for it.  If I like the way things work, I'll work on using it.
not a bad idea, I'm using it for a USB/QEMU stick computer when I travel to Japan
Also, is there a way to install the distro?  Maybe on another partition?
I'm not sure I don't think I ever tried it
yea, I've never tried dual-booting linux and linux, lol
I guess that your be kinda dumb to do...I would imagine most things I can do in backtrack can be done in Ubuntu...Maybe just a little easier?
sorry i meant to say that would be kinda dumb...
